footer.copyright: Â© {{year}} K6 Commander. All rights reserved.

about.title: About K6 Commander
about.description: A lightweight, local-first, authorized load-testing platform that combines the power of k6, Lighthouse, and AI analysis into a single, sleek UI.
about.localFirstDescription: All your test configurations and history are stored in your browser. No cloud accounts needed.
about.unifiedToolingDescription: Run load tests, Lighthouse audits, and SEO analysis from a single interface.
about.k6FeatureDescription: Simulate traffic to find performance bottlenecks.
about.k6HowItWorks: Leverage the full power of Grafana k6 to understand how your system behaves under load. Configure virtual users (VUs), duration, and custom ramping stages.
about.k6HowItWorks2: Live results are streamed to a pre-configured Grafana dashboard, giving you real-time insights into request rates, response times, and errors.
about.lighthouseFeatureDescription: Audit for performance, accessibility, and more.
about.lighthouseHowItWorks: Run Google Lighthouse audits directly from the UI. Get scores for Performance, Accessibility, Best Practices, and SEO.
about.lighthouseHowItWorks2: The application provides a high-level summary, and you can access the full, interactive HTML report for a deep-dive analysis and actionable recommendations.
about.seoHowItWorks: Get a deep, AI-powered analysis of the most critical on-page SEO elements to ensure your pages are optimized for search engines.
about.seoHowItWorks2: This includes checks for title tags, meta descriptions, H1s, canonicals, and Open Graph tags, complete with AI-generated suggestions for improvement.
about.stackDescription: K6 Commander is built with modern, industry-standard technologies.
about.involvedDescription: This is an open source project. Contributions, issues, and feature requests are welcome!

steps.welcome: Welcome to K6 Commander! This is your main dashboard.
steps.history: You can view and manage your past test runs here.
steps.about: Learn more about how the application works here.
steps.github: View the source code or report issues on GitHub here.
steps.urlInput: Enter the URL you want to test here. You can select from recent URLs.
steps.testSuites: Choose which test suites you want to run: Load Test, Lighthouse Audit, or AI SEO Analysis.
steps.requestConfig: Configure the details of your HTTP request here, like method, headers, and body.
steps.loadProfile: Choose a pre-defined load profile or create your own custom scenario.
steps.runTest: When you're ready, click here to start your tests!

form.title: New Test Run
form.description: Configure the parameters for your next test run.
form.urlDescription: The full URL of the page or endpoint you wish to test.
form.testSuitesDescription: Select one or more test suites to execute.
form.seoSwitchDescription: Perform an in-depth on-page SEO analysis.
form.requestConfigDescription: Customize the HTTP request for the load test.
form.loadProfileDescription: Define the amount of load to generate during the test.
form.customProfileDescription: Define your own configuration for VUs, duration, or stages.
form.stagesDescription: For complex load scenarios with ramping up/down VUs over time.

error.atLeastOne: At least one test suite must be selected.

toast.historyClearedDescription: Your local test history has been cleared.
toast.testStartedDescription: Your tests are now running. Monitor the progress below.

clearHistoryDialog.title: Clear Existing History?
clearHistoryDialog.description: You have existing test history. Would you like to clear it before running this new test?

running.title: Running Tests...
running.description: Please wait while the selected suites complete. This may take a few minutes.

summary.title: Test Summary
summary.description: The results for your test run on

history.title: Test History
history.description: Browse and manage your past test runs.
history.noHistoryDescription: Run a new test to start your history.

clearAllDialog.title: Are you sure?
clearAllDialog.description: This action cannot be undone. This will permanently delete all of your test history data and recent URLs.

deleteDialog.title: Delete this entry?
deleteDialog.description: This action cannot be undone. This will permanently delete this test run from your history.

toast.exportSuccessDescription: Your test history has been downloaded as a JSON file.
toast.importFailDescription: Could not read the selected file.
toast.deleteSuccessDescription: The test run has been removed from your history.
toast.clearSuccessDescription: Your entire test history has been removed.
